questions.question:
A car accelerates uniformly from rest to 20 m/s over a distance of 100m.

a) Calculate the acceleration of the car. (3 marks)
b) Calculate the time taken. (3 marks)
c) If the mass of the car is 1200 kg, calculate the force needed to produce this acceleration. (3 marks)
d) Explain why the actual force needed would be greater than your calculated value. (3 marks)
answer: b) Using v = u + at (3 marks)
questions.explanation: This question tests understanding of motion equations, forces, and real-world applications.

questions.question:
A transformer has 500 turns on its primary coil and 100 turns on its secondary coil. The input voltage is 230V.

a) Calculate the output voltage. (2 marks)
b) If the output current is 10A, calculate the input current assuming 100% efficiency. (3 marks)
c) Calculate the power loss if the actual input current is 2.5A. (3 marks)
d) Suggest two ways the efficiency could be improved and explain how each would work. (4 marks)
answer: - Laminated core to reduce eddy currents
- Better insulation to reduce heat loss
- Improved core material to reduce magnetic losses
questions.explanation: This question combines calculations with practical understanding of transformers and energy efficiency.
